page.title: 01ALDERTON AND TODDINGTON
page.content: The area bounded by the villages of Alderton and Toddington lies at the foot of the Cotswold escarpment near the ancient Saxon borough of Winchcombe. It is a flat area of fertile land forming the edge of the Vale of Evesham, noted for its fruit and vegetable production. The flatness of the land is relieved by several high and isolated limestone outcrops the most notable being Bredon Hill. The area is mainly agricultural but there is a small industrial estate at Toddington and a large hauliers at Gretton Fields. It is typical of rural Gloucestershire with picturesque villages of Cotswold stone houses and churches.
